page.title: 06Gwynfryn C.P. School
page.content: The school was opened in 1909 and was named Minera Council School.On the first day 106 pupils attended.There were four teachers including the headmaster.Nearly all the children were Welsh speaking. The building was of locally quarried stone.It was in the shape of a rectangle and the children were taught in three classes separated by wood partitions. Today the school has 37 pupils aged between four and eleven years.They are taught by the headteacher and an infants' teacher.Not one of the children comes from a Welsh speaking home. The school now has its own kitchen and indoor toilets but there is no assembly hall,Head's office or a room for the teachers.There is a large sloping yard and a playing field.
